6.9/10 - Fun Poker for Beginners; Free Chips and Bots Included?

This is free to play so I automatically give it a few bonus points. You can earn daily chips; always find a game that will suit your needs. It's now known that there are bots that will play against you, and aggressively push you to spend more chips. I've found that this hasn't really impacted my play style, chip count or entertainment level. Seems a little shady if you are purchasing chips, but I wouldn't. Every day I win more and more so this seems to be a non-factor. You will also start off with a sizable welcome package which is plenty to get you winning!

The blackjack does suck; I've never been so unlucky when it comes to winning with 18-20 in hand! It should be at least a good chance you will win at that point. My biggest dislike in the game though is the chat! You can only choose from a set number of premade responses. The developers stated that adding a real chat would force them to raise the legal age of the game. Seems like a small price to pay for a feature that would add so much transparency. I'm calling ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t on that one!

Overall, It's FREE. Bots of Not I'm having fun. You'll never need to buy chips either.

Originally posted by ABOUT:Governor of Poker 3 is the best free multiplayer poker game with a great design. In this multi-player version of Governor of Poker you compete live with thousands of real poker players to prove you are the best and number 1 Texas Hold ’em poker star!

Becoming a poker pro is a long journey through Texas; you will start as a rookie and work yourself all the way up to become a VIP poker player, a high roller to end up winning high stake games in the Gold area.
Governor of Poker 3 released on Steam Feb. 19th, 2016. Minor bugs here and there, but let's not get ahead of ourselves. If you look at other poker games on Steam they are either not multiplayer or way too pricey to even consider buying, especially when review negativity is quite high. I've been looking for a great poker game on Steam and I've found it besides Tabletop Simulator.

If you're looking for a great poker game, you've found it so stop looking. It is free. It is an MMO. Play. YOUR. HEART. OUT.

The beginning of Governor of Poker 3 goes through a minor tutorial telling you what to do with whatever it is pointing at. They start you off with $35,000 and level 1. You can choose to play Blackjack (alone) or play poker with hundreds if not thousands of people and a ton of money at stake. If you are new to poker I'm sure you'd be a master player before that $35,000 ran out. There's a helper sheet that tells you what is a pair, two pair, three of a kind, etc.

After you are ready to head out and start playing, each place" requires X level to unlock and participate in. These "places" to play poker in are in specific areas. Once you start going up in level you unlock certain places that have high buy-ins to play with a great amount of money.

Play tournaments and hope you will win. Tournaments have quite big buy-ins and if you lose you don't buy back in. Take as much money as possible and be wise about it

reviewText:
Oh my goodness. With real poker banned, this really scratches the old itch. Completely demolished the beginners table haha, until I met a good challenge heads up. So good. Nice match making. The UI is really in your face at first, but you get used to it quick.

It's simply poker. Multiplayer. Done well.

If you want the solo experience, get Governer of Poker 2, which is also excellent with quite realistic AI. I have about 30 hours in that while online and I can imagine me wasting away many hours in this.

Also to people complaining about the need to buy chips with real world money. You don't have to. Chips spawn every few hours. A nice sum to get you back. Chips need to have scarcity or poker won't work. With no risk it just becomes a donkey fest with everyone going in all in all the time and ruining the experience.

These developers has done a good job not making it pay to win, including risk, and making it fun. A very difficult balance.
